section.title: Description
section.paragraph: This element is defines various mIRC colors.
This element is optional and may appear one or more times per scheme.

attributes.attribute: The name of the color, as used in mIRC's colors dialog
The index of the desired color

keywords.keyword: The color used for window backgrounds
The color used to display actions (/me, /describe)
The color used to display CTCP text
The color used to display highlighted text
The color used to display information

The color used to display join events
The color used to display kick events

The normal text color

The color used to display user-input messages
The color used to display part events

section.title: Engine Requirements
section.paragraph: If a list has been specified in the parent 'colors' element, the engine should first apply that list. Any additional declarations in this section should be applied afterward.
If no definition for a color has been specified individually or as part of a list, the engine should revert the color back to "mIRC Classic" (the default color).
